1.brief: literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
Shittim, a place East of the Jordan
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
Jarden, the principal river of Palestine

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, a scribe, i.e. (by analogy or implication) an official superintendent or magistrate
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
an encampment (of travellers or troops); hence, an army, whether literal (of soldiers) or figurative (of dancers, angels, cattle, locusts, stars; or even the sacred courts)

3.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
a Levite or descendant of Levi
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

4.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or

hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand

properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
